decision.decision_question: Which infrastructure migration strategy should NexTech commit to for decommissioning the Blackwood data center while ensuring business continuity, compliance, and future innovation capacity?

result.decision_question: Which infrastructure migration strategy should NexTech commit to for decommissioning the Blackwood data center while ensuring business continuity, compliance, and future innovation capacity?

threat_of_new_entrants.name: Threat of New Entrants
threat_of_new_entrants.relevance_rationale: New entrants could disrupt the market dynamics, but the existing infrastructure and expertise required limit their impact.

effect_by_option.description: New entrants may find it challenging to compete with established hyperscalers, potentially limiting the impact on this option.
key_assumptions: Established hyperscalers have significant market share.
New entrants lack the resources to compete effectively.
key_unknowns: Potential for new technologies that could lower barriers to entry.

effect_by_option.description: This option may face moderate threats from new entrants offering innovative solutions that combine colocation and private cloud services.
key_assumptions: New entrants can innovate in hybrid solutions.
Existing providers may not adapt quickly.

effect_by_option.description: The multi-cloud approach may be less affected by new entrants due to the dominance of established cloud providers.
key_assumptions: AWS and Google Cloud have strong brand loyalty.
New entrants struggle to gain market trust.

shared_assumptions: Market dynamics are influenced by existing players.

supplier_power.name: Supplier Power
supplier_power.relevance_rationale: The power of suppliers can significantly impact the cost and availability of services for each option.

effect_by_option.description: High supplier power from hyperscalers can lead to increased costs and reduced flexibility.
key_unknowns: Potential for new suppliers to emerge.
Changes in pricing models by hyperscalers.

effect_by_option.description: This option may benefit from moderate supplier power, allowing for negotiation on services.
key_assumptions: Multiple suppliers exist for colocation services.
Private cloud solutions can be customized.

effect_by_option.description: Supplier power is high due to reliance on major cloud providers, which can dictate terms.
key_assumptions: AWS and Google Cloud dominate the market.

shared_assumptions: Supplier relationships are critical for service delivery.
shared_unknowns: Impact of technological advancements on supplier power.

buyer_power.name: Buyer Power
buyer_power.relevance_rationale: The power of buyers can influence pricing and service offerings across options.

effect_by_option.description: Buyers may have limited power due to the dominance of hyperscalers, leading to less favorable terms.
Buyers may exert moderate power, allowing for negotiation on service levels and pricing.
key_assumptions: Buyers have multiple options for hybrid solutions.

effect_by_option.description: Buyers may have some power due to the availability of multiple cloud options, but major providers still dominate.
key_assumptions: Buyers seek flexibility in cloud services.
key_unknowns: Impact of new entrants on buyer power.

substitutes.name: Threat of Substitutes
substitutes.relevance_rationale: The availability of substitute solutions can impact the attractiveness of each option.

effect_by_option.description: The threat of substitutes is low as hyperscalers offer unique capabilities that are hard to replicate.
key_unknowns: Emerging technologies that could serve as substitutes.

effect_by_option.description: Moderate threat from substitutes exists as businesses may consider alternative hybrid solutions.
key_unknowns: Changes in regulatory environments affecting substitutes.

effect_by_option.description: The threat of substitutes is moderate as businesses may explore other cloud combinations.
key_unknowns: Emerging competitors in the cloud space.

shared_assumptions: Innovation drives the threat of substitutes.

rivalry.name: Competitive Rivalry
rivalry.relevance_rationale: High levels of competition can influence pricing and service quality across options.

effect_by_option.description: Intense rivalry among hyperscalers can lead to competitive pricing and improved services.
key_assumptions: Hyperscalers compete aggressively for market share.

effect_by_option.description: Moderate rivalry exists as various providers compete in the hybrid space, impacting service offerings.
High rivalry exists among cloud providers, leading to competitive pricing and service enhancements.
key_assumptions: Cloud providers are in constant competition.
Innovation is a key competitive factor.
key_unknowns: Impact of new entrants on rivalry.

shared_assumptions: Rivalry affects pricing and service quality.
Market dynamics are influenced by competition.
